dta.TransitSegment¶

class TransitSegment(id, link, label, lane, dwell, stopside)¶

Bases: object

A piece of a TransitLine, basically a link with a transit line on it.

A link in a TransitLine. The public instance variables of this class have the same names as the parameters.

Variables:
  • id – segment identifier
  • link – the RoadLink instance on which the transit segment runs
  • label – user-defined label for the segment or stop, a string
  • tlane – the lane used by the transit line. Use TransitSegment.TRANSIT_LANE_UNSPECIFIED, 1 for the outside lane, 2 for the next in, etc
  • dwell – is the average dwell time in seconds, a float
  • stopside – one of TransitSegment.STOP_EXIT_LANE, TransitSegment.STOP_OUTSIDE, or TransitSegment.STOP_INSIDE
__init__(id, link, label, lane, dwell, stopside)¶

A link in a TransitLine. The public instance variables of this class have the same names as the parameters.

Variables:
  • id – segment identifier
  • link – the RoadLink instance on which the transit segment runs
  • label – user-defined label for the segment or stop, a string
  • tlane – the lane used by the transit line. Use TransitSegment.TRANSIT_LANE_UNSPECIFIED, 1 for the outside lane, 2 for the next in, etc
  • dwell – is the average dwell time in seconds, a float
  • stopside – one of TransitSegment.STOP_EXIT_LANE, TransitSegment.STOP_OUTSIDE, or TransitSegment.STOP_INSIDE

Methods

__init__(id, link, label, lane, dwell, stopside) A link in a TransitLine. The public instance variables of this class have the same names as the parameters.
getDynameqHeaderStr() Returns the Dynameq-formatted header string (the start of the file preceding the actual transit line data
getDynameqStr() Returns the Dynameq-formatted string representation of the transit segments.

Attributes

STOP_EXIT_LANE int(x[, base]) -> integer
STOP_INSIDE int(x[, base]) -> integer
STOP_OUTSIDE int(x[, base]) -> integer
TRANSIT_LANE_OUTSIDE int(x[, base]) -> integer
TRANSIT_LANE_UNSPECIFIED int(x[, base]) -> integer
STOP_EXIT_LANE = 0¶

No other traffic lanes are blocked during dwell time

STOP_INSIDE = 2¶

Stops are made on the inside edge of the roadway

STOP_OUTSIDE = 1¶

Stops are made on the outside edge of the roadway

TRANSIT_LANE_OUTSIDE = 1¶

Outside lane

TRANSIT_LANE_UNSPECIFIED = 0¶

If the transit lane is unspecified use this for the lane arg to TransitSegment.__init__()

classmethod getDynameqHeaderStr()¶

Returns the Dynameq-formatted header string (the start of the file preceding the actual transit line data

getDynameqStr()¶

Returns the Dynameq-formatted string representation of the transit segments.
